--- In gladiator@y..., "Tom Tildrum" <Tevildo@h...> wrote:
> Actually, Dan, I COULDN'T make a list of scenarios with numbers and 
whatnot. 
> First of all, it would give away some of the secret scenarios (and 
let me 
> tell you, I had a hell of a time figuring out ways to hide them), 
and 
> secondly it would invalidate the Garden of Golden Apples. The whole 
purpose 
> of the Garden was making you WORK for that information. Happy 
hunting.

Ok, I can buy that.  Last time I went through the tevfifty I missed 
the Garden of Golden Apples.

The 
> most important thing, I think is to keep the levels unique and 
varied. I 
> know I had a lot of narrow passages in TevFifty, but there were also 
a lot 
> of open battlefields for the melee-lovers out there. And I don't 
know of 
> anyone else who's used a floating staircase as the setting for a 
battle...

Just wait until I get around to making 'The Weakest Link'.  Remember 
the strength of a chain is determined by it's weakest link so you can 
guess what that scenario's looks will be.  It will have a couple of 
near duplicates.  

I have converted one of my scenarios into a pre-quel for 'The Brag'.  
The title of the pre-quel is 'The Inheritance' and you can probably 
guess which scenario got converted.

Back to what makes a good scenario:

Navigatible - If you have lots of doors and lots of keys, there should 
 be some pattern to keep the player from getting frustrated.  If you 
have lots of teleporters, there should be a pattern to where they go 
just to help the player out.

Speaking of teleporters, I would request a revision to how teleporters 
work: ability to press some key to teleport when on top of a 
teleporter.  I have got frustrated at times trying to get the 
teleporter to work with some of my faster characters.  Anyone else 
with problems with teleporters?

In case y'all are wondering, I have been promoted to group moderator 
and I am trying to keep messages flowing daily.
